question.title: How can I overload toString via annotation?
question.body:
I have my custom toString that masks some fields of DTO:

@Data
@NoArgsConstructor
@AllArgsConstructor
public class Tested {
    private String name;

    private String surname;

    @ToString.Include(name = "surname")
    public String surnameMasked() {
        //for simplicity let's say I change everything but first letter to *
        return maskDefaultField(surname);
    }
}

I want this:

//should produce "Tested(name=John, surname=S****)"
public printMasked(Tested tested) {
    System.out.println(tested);
}

//should produce "Tested(surname=John, name=Smith)"
public printUnMasked(@Unmasked Tested tested) {
    System.out.println(tested);
}

Is this possible?

answers.body:
Lombok developer here: There is no way to ask lombok to generate a toString() implementation that isn't named @Override public String toString() {}.

In other words, impossible.

Which would presumably result in a new question: Will lombok ever support such things / what would it take for lombok to add such a feature. I shall answer that too, given that "no you can't" with no further context would be a thoroughly uninspiring answer.

I doubt we'd accept such a feature request or even a PR to add it; we'd need a thorough investigation on how useful that'd be. For example, if a bevy of non-trivial public-source projects out there could have used it, that'd be pretty much required for us to accept such a feature request.

Ordinarily one could make the chicken-and-egg argument (no projects write their API with style X today because it's way too much boilerplate to do this; that's why it needs to be a lombok feature, so that developers can start writing their APIs in the superior-if-not-for-all-the-boilerplate style X, we'd all be better off), but I don't think there are hordes of folks who would have written toString-esque methods if only it wasn't so much boilerplate. I'm pretty sure no such argument would ever work.

Just trying to be clear about what it'd take to get such a feature added to Lombok. Remember, it's a boilerplate busting tool: If a tiny minority of people would use the heck out of a feature but the rest of the ecosystem never would, it doesn't matter that it'd be ridiculously useful to you and your small group; that's not "boilerplate", at least not the way lombok defines it.

question_comments.body: If you want to apply the attribute in the method, then just use a different method. That is exactly what your example is showing. Just remove the attribute.
Why not just have a separate toStringUnmasked() method?
